questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: Be more experience in R and get to know more functions.

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: Get a better understanding of R, so I can start writing code myself and use R more for my studies

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: How to operate R and code in R and use the functionality of the R packages

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: How to set up and work with data in a more reproducible way. I would like to transfer my data analysis from SPSS to R(studio) as I see more options here.

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: How to use R for data analysis. I would like to use R to analyse and visualize my data.

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: How to use R in data analyses.

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: I expect to be able to know how to do reproducible research using R, the basics of how to use R (and how to do it in wise way with markdowns etc).

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: I expect to get a better understanding of how R works and how to use R. I will use this to get a better work flow when working with my data.

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: I expect to getting to know R. I hope to get so familiar with R that I can use it for my postdoc studies.

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: I expect to learn how to improve the way of data analysis and how to make it reproducible, learn about "standards" in the field. I expect to apply obtained knowledge for the analysis of data in my PhD project and to make proper reports and publications.

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: I expect to learn how to use R so I can apply it for my MS analysis data during by PhD project.

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: I have been using R on and off duringthe last years, but haven't really felt that I understood  "the basics" - this I hope to get a better understanding of atthis course, to make me feel more confident that I am doing Things rihgt when using R, and to improve my ability to troubleshoot.

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: I have used R on a few occasion, but only scripts prepared by others. I would like to get an insight to R to understand but also validate the scrips I have been using and to be able to do (at least some of) the trouble shooting my self

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: I want to be comfortable using R for some basic analysis and visualization so I can keep learning and use R for my data analysis on a regular basis. As well understand posting to Github.

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: I would like to get started with R to expand my data analysis skills

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: I would like to learn how to code common analysis like ANOVA. I would also like to learn how to present results on a graph e.g. glucose measurements done multiple times over a few hours.

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: Learn how to make more reproduciable scripts

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: Make figures utilizing data from online databases, excel spreadsheets, do RNA-Seq analysis

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: Organize the data so it can be used for statistical analysis, t test, ANOVA. Run this analysis and building all forms of graphs.

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: Structured, reproducible approach to using R and git for future use in analyses

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: The basics of coding in Rstudio and afterwards being able to import data and make descriptive data analysis in R

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: To get an introduction to work with R and tidyverse in a structured and reproducible way.

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: To have some knowledge about programming in R

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: To learn about R and how to use it. I would like to be able to analyse my own data, and make figures.

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: To learn how to use R in a structured way, to be able how to solve problems with code and R in general.

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: how to be more systematic about data management, including knowledge about new packages and functions

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: how to use R

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: All in all it was good.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: All-in-all most of the instructions were good

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: Description of the main tools/ R packages and how to install them

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: Everything was very nicely explained.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: Good instructions to get started and prepare for the course.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: I liked it, but the colors and the output was not the same as on my screen. Furthermore, when pressing the links, a new window should be open in stead of replacing the existing sheet.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: I liked the overall set-up of the pre-course tasks and the instructions given. In conclusion, I think it worked very well.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: I think it was a great introduction, and I liked the video guides. In addition, it was easy to read and understand

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: It is nice to have all the material gathered in one site. Then it is much easier to find things needed and to make an overview.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: It is nice with a introduction that clearly states what we can expect from the course, what you expect from us etc.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: It was good. Not too long, clear instructions. I like that there is a check to ensure I did everything.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: It's a nice guidance materials, well structured with many useful links.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: Nice detailed installation instructions!

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: Step-by-step, easy to follow.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: Structured step-by-step guide with clear and concise instructions

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: That you explained along theway why you had to do the different steps. I.e. that you use :: to load part of packages

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: The example videos were great and pictorial guides in reference to 4 panels.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: The instructions about how to install the programs and the videos from Rstudio were good.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: The instructions were great. The instructions video and copy paste functions was a nice touch. Also, the introduction to the R world was very fine. Overall, the task was easy and informative, I feel suited for the course.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: The instructions were very clear on how to download the program

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: The videos made it easy to install the different things

responses: Worked fine

questions: Please describe the problems you've had.
responses: 1) I didn't get the "DONE" after running the remotes installation. But I was able to do the rest of the preparation, so I think it worked at the end.2) I was asked if I wanted to install a compiliation when running remotes::install_gitlab("rostools/r3", upgrade = TRUE), I pressed yes, and it took forever and didn't look like the video. So I STOPped it and ran it again and this time pressed no, and then it looked fine.
